intro: Draba extensa, commonly known as the broadleaf whitlow grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during the spring and early summer. Draba extensa is often found in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine and arctic regions.
